subject: Productivity
title: Notification Culture
description: A micro-lesson that makes Notification Culture usable.

hook.text: The average smartphone user receives 80 notifications per day. Each one hijacks attention.

buildup.text: Notifications trigger a dopamine response. The brain treats each buzz as potentially important.

discovery.text: Research shows that even unread notifications reduce cognitive performance. Knowing they exist distracts.

twist.text: Apps are designed by attention engineers. Their goal is your time, not your wellbeing.

climax.text: Turning off non-essential notifications is one of the highest-leverage productivity changes.

punchline.text: Every notification is someone else's priority.

quiz.question: What effect do even unread notifications have?
